Bondi Beach shooting in Sydney kills at least 12, Australian PM decries 'act of antisemitism'
subhead: The attack, which killed 12 people including one gunman, took place during an annual 'Hanukkah by the Sea' event in Australia's largest city. Police declared it a 'terrorist incident' and said they had found suspected 'improvised explosive devices' linked to one of the two alleged shooters.

title: Hong Kong's oldest pro-democracy party disbands
subhead: The party was founded in 1994, near the end of British colonial rule, when Hong Kong's leading liberal groups merged. At Sunday's meeting, 117 out of 121 members voted for the group's liquidation, with the remaining four votes being blank ballots.

title: China-Japan crisis deepens amid bomber flights and canceled concerts
subhead: The US voiced its military support for Japan in response to joint Chinese-Russian military exercises, after Donald Trump initially appeared to side with China by urging Tokyo not to involve itself in the Taiwan issue.
byline: By Philippe Mesmer (Tokyo (Japan) correspondence) and Harold Thibault (Beijing (China) correspondent)

title: Mory Sacko, the calm celebrity chef: 'I have no score to settle with life'
subhead: He rose to fame on 'Top Chef' in 2020 and has since become a charismatic figure in France's new wave of gastronomy. At the helm of Mosuke, his Michelin-starred restaurant in Paris, Mory Sacko has created a small culinary empire built on joy and serenity.

title: Louvre heist puts French museums on high alert
subhead: Seven cultural institutions in France experienced burglaries with increasingly violent methods between September and October, revealing significant shortcomings in their security measures.
byline: By Roxana Azimi and Laurent Telo

title: The actor and rape accusations behind Brigitte Macron's 'stupid bitches' remark
subhead: France's first lady made headlines with her comments about feminist activists who disrupted a performance of the comedian Ary Abittan. They were contesting the dropping of rape charges against him earlier this year. Le Monde reviewed the ruling and spoke to the plaintiff.

title: 'Trump's ideological challenge to Europe is more dangerous than the security one'
subhead: The Trump administration has cast itself as the protector of 'Western civilization.' Elon Musk wants the European Union to be dismantled. It is up to European democrats to contest this role and fight this battle, argues Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: The mysterious 'knocker' scaring elderly women in a Brittany town
subhead: For more than two years, a prowler has been knocking on doors and shutters during the night in a village in Brittany, France, creating a climate of fear among his preferred targets: elderly women. Authorities were slow to take the case seriously.
